title: Minor fixes to the get-started/wordcount-example webpage.
body:
As I was going through the [wordcount example](https://beam.apache.org/get-started/wordcount-example/) in the Get started tutorial, I've noticed two minor issues. 1) In the Python example of [adding timestamps to data](https://beam.apache.org/get-started/wordcount-example/#adding-timestamps-to-data), the `AddTimestampFn` is initialized with a single parameter, but the class actually takes two, as is visible in the later example, where the class is defined. 2) The [streaming wordcount example](https://beam.apache.org/get-started/wordcount-example/#reading-an-unbounded-dataset), uses deprecated methods `ReadStringsFromPubSub` and `WriteStringsToPubSub`. These are replaced by `ReadFromPubSub` and `WriteToPubSub`. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-8660] Use PortableOptions.artifact_endpoint if provided over value reported from jobserver
body:
It looks like there may have been a regression to BEAM-8660 (https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/10108). This fixes the intended behavior of --artifact_endpoint to override the artifact endpoint reported by the jobserver. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9616] Add RegisterDoFn
body:
Adds a beam.RegisterDoFn call for users to call on their DoFns instead of individually calling RegisterFunction and RegisterType for all parameter types, using reflection. These registrations are important to ensure workers can process and lookup types and functions correctly. This PR also lets starcgen key off of RegisterDoFn in addition to the identifiers list. Only transforms/top has been adjusted to demonstrate, and a full go generate ./... pass run on the SDK to demonstrate that the code generator works in both modes simultaneously. In time, we'll remove the identifiers approach and require RegisterDoFn as the only way to hint to the code generator. The extra changes are go fmt changes missed from other PRs and are benign. TODO in later PRs: * Make use of RegisterDoFn everywhere in the GoSDK and examples and document it as a best practice. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Clean up CHANGES.md in preparation for 2.25.0 release.
body:
There were duplicate sections for 2.25.0, so I removed the extra one. Also added some JIRA links. R: @tvalentyn ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-6103] Enable BQ streaming insert timeouts
body:
Testing has shown that this does not seem to affect performance and memory usage. In case of timeout, we have found that a transient 400 error may be reported by BQ. In these cases the runner had always retried the bundle successfully. Also fixes second -> millisecond conversion for flag. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10937] Tour of Beam: Getting started notebook
body:
This is the first notebook of a new _"Tour of Beam"_ section we want to create to help improve the onboarding experience for beginners. The plan is to have the _"Tour of Beam"_ section to include links to all the notebooks we currently have, as well as to offer a new set of introductory notebooks to explain concepts gradually in an interactive environment. The landing page will come up as following PR. This notebook covers the following: * Basic concepts: pipeline, `PCollection`, `PTransform` * Explanation of the `|` and `>>` operators * Basic transforms: `Map`, `FlatMap`, `Filter`, `Combine`, `GroupByKey` The _"What's next?"_ section at the end of the notebook contains links to existing documentation, but will be updated once we have more notebooks for new topics. R: @aaltay R: @rosetn Staged: https://colab.sandbox.google.com/github/apache/beam/blob/c81acf8e809bbca533fc0cae56d7ad96efaf8cb4/examples/notebooks/tour-of-beam/getting-started.ipynb ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10861]Adds PubSub Runner API encoding to Read/Write transforms
body:

title: [BEAM-10935] Replace @abstractproperty with @abstractmethod
body:
Replace deprecated `@abstractproperty` with `@abstractmethod` and `@property` since Python2 is no longer supported. https://docs.python.org/3/library/abc.html#abc.abstractproperty ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10814][BEAM-10570] DataframeTransform outputs elements
body:
This PR adds the ability for `DataframeTransform` to produce element-wise PCollections, via a new `UnbatchPandas` transform. The original behavior is still available, with a `yield_dataframes=True` option. In order to support this, the PR also adds more robust support for converting between native Python types and pandas/numpy dtypes. Note that pandas' catch-all `np.object` type is mapped to `typing.Any`. This PR also closes BEAM-10570 - it adds support for RowCoder to encode fields with arbitrary Python types using FastPrimitivesCoder. title: [BEAM-7746] Get mypy passing on runners.worker
body:

title: [BEAM-10933] Adjust GBK type before creating the pipeline proto
body:
These have to be done before creating the pipeline proto for Dataflow to be able to correctly generate job requests from portable protos. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9136] Add CSV for python dependency license names, URLs and types
body:
To help check the python dependency licenses, add python-licenses.csv to /opt/apache/beam/third_party_licenses/ that lists the name, url, and license type for the licenses found by pip-licenses in the pull_licenses_py.py script. ``` ./gradlew -Pdocker-pull-licenses :sdks:python:container:py37:docker docker run -it --entrypoint bash apache/beam_python3.7_sdk:2.25.0.dev # wc -l /opt/apache/beam/third_party_licenses/python-licenses.csv 84 /opt/apache/beam/third_party_licenses/python-licenses.csv # tail /opt/apache/beam/third_party_licenses/python-licenses.csv tenacity,https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jd/tenacity/master/LICENSE,Apache Software License tensorboard,https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tensorflow/tensorboard/master/LICENSE,Apache Software License tensorboard-plugin-wit,https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PAIR-code/what-if-tool/master/LICENSE,Apache 2.0 tensorflow,https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/master/LICENSE,Apache Software License tensorflow-estimator,https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tensorflow/estimator/master/LICENSE,Apache Software License termcolor,file:///tmp/license_scripts/manual_licenses/termcolor/LICENSE,MIT License typing-extensions,https://github.com/python/typing/blob/master/typing_extensions/README.rst,Python Software Foundation License urllib3,https://urllib3.readthedocs.io/,MIT License wrapt,https://raw.githubusercontent.com/GrahamDumpleton/wrapt/master/LICENSE,BSD License zipp,https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jaraco/zipp/master/LICENSE,MIT License ``` +R: @Hannah-Jiang ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Convert type comments into full Python2 annotations.

A simple pass of com2ann and yapf. The only manual change was removing a stray comma. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-10930] Use dense JSON responses for BigQueryIO interactions
body:
This updates requests made by the BigQuery IO connector to specify the underlying prettyPrint=false GET param to have BigQuery return dense JSON responses. Without it, BigQueryIO receives pretty-printed JSON responses from the BigQuery service, which represent a potentially significant inflation in unnecessary whitespace bytes. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-2146] Continuously test Dataflow ValidatesRunner forcing streaming
body:
DataflowRunner automatically detects bounded/unbounded collections and will run in batch mode if possible. This forces a run in streaming mode, since this is most of the important coverage. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Allow pandas 1.x.
body:
We may not want to require 1.x yet, but we shouldn't exclude it. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: Fix up-to-date checking mechanism on Tox Task.
body:
The Tox Test task included test reports which include timestamps as an input which would cause the up-to-date checking mechanism to always report not up-to-date. The test reports aren't actually used as input and should be ignored. The second change is to declare the output as a directory instead of a file tree. Using a file tree as an output turns of caching for the task. https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/more_about_tasks.html#sec:up_to_date_checks ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10643] Major rearrangement of Nexmark dashboards
body:
This PR removes runner vs. runner comparison, which wasn't particularly useful. Instead, dashboards now compare different implementations for the same query (Standard, SQL or ZetaSQL). For more details, see a discussion: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-10643 Screenshots: ![Screenshot_2020-09-17 Nexmark - Grafana](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16625383/93463556-3562f400-f8e8-11ea-8e79-75252df831ee.png) ![Screenshot_2020-09-17 Nexmark - Grafana(1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16625383/93463562-372cb780-f8e8-11ea-9e02-b550b844184c.png) ![Screenshot_2020-09-17 Nexmark Spark Classic New SQL - Grafana](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16625383/93463566-385de480-f8e8-11ea-8b69-c40ac89b3bed.png) ![Screenshot_2020-09-17 Nexmark Spark Classic New Standard - Grafana](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16625383/93463569-398f1180-f8e8-11ea-994b-f4116f221d56.png) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10816] Make KinesisClientThrottledException public
body:
`KinesisClientThrottledException` is a type of argument used in `RateLimitPolicy.onThrottle()`, which should be implemented by user in case of using custom `RateLimitPolicy`. So, it should be `public` as a part of user API. R: @iemejia ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9680] Add Aggregation Min and Max lessons to Go SDK katas
body:
This pull request adds an aggregation min and max lessons to the Go SDK katas. As we discussed, I've combined what normally would have comprised two PRs for each lesson into one since they are both very similar. I would like to request the following reviewer: (R: @lostluck ) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10915] Fix error hint for AVG(INT64).
body:
Long-term fix is to implement AVG(INT64) (BEAM-8043), but for now we should at least correct this. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9547] Raise NotImplementedError and WontImplementError throughout DeferredDataframe
body:
This PR reduces the number of skipped test cases in `pandas.core.frame` down to 36 (6.3%), and they are all due to issues with the test framework, not unimplemented functionality. The rest of the test cases raise wont implement (13.5%), raise not implemented (11.5%), or pass (68.7%). ### Now raises WontImplementError - Series.memory_usage - `Series.__contains__` - checks for a value in the entire index. Maybe this could be implemented as a deferred scalar? - [`DataFrame.info`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.info.html) ### Now raises NotImplementedError I'm pretty confident the following could be implemented at least partially: - `DataFrame.__getitem__(DeferredBase)` - [`DataFrame.apply`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.apply.html) - [`DataFrame.explode`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.explode.html) - [`DataFrame.isin`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.isin.html) - [`DataFrame.assign`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.assign.html) - [`DataFrame.combine`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.combine.html) - [`DataFrame.combine_first`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.combine_first.html) - [`DataFrame.drop`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.drop.html) - [`DataFrame.eval`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.eval.html) - [`DataFrame.melt`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.melt.html) - [`DataFrame.at`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.at.html) - [`DataFrame.count`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.count.html) - [`DataFrame.cov`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.cov.html) - [`DataFrame.corr`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.corr.html) - [`DataFrame.dot`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.dot.html) - [`DataFrame.pivot`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.pivot.html) - [`DataFrame.pivot_table`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.pivot_table.html) I _think_ the following could be implemented: - [`Series.reindex`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.Series.reindex.html) - [`DataFrame.index`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.index) (deferred access and assignment) - [`DataFrame.reindex`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.reindex.html) - [`DataFrame.append`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.append.html) ### New functionality - Arithmetic operators for DataFrame I provided implementations for the following functions dealing with columns, but they're not deferred which seems wrong: - [`DataFrame.columns`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.columns.html) - `DataFrame.__contains__` - [`DataFrame.axes`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.axes.html) (returns `(self.index, self.columns)`, so it will fail until `index` is supported) Post-Commit Tests Status (on master branch) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Lang | SDK | Dataflow | Flink | Samza | Spark | Twister2 --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Go | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- Java | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/)

title: [BEAM-9547] Add not_implemented_ok
body:
Adds an additional option to doctest, `not_implemented_ok`, which works identically to `wont_implement_ok`, but allows `NotImplementedError` to be raised. My goal is to minimize the number of skipped tests, so anything unsupported raises `WontImplementError` or `NotImplementedError`. `NotImplementedError`s should link to a jira so users can indicate interest in a feature and track it's support. title: Update BigQueryAvroUtils.java to properly support BOOL type of Big Query
body:
see fromTableFieldSchemaType of BigQueryUtils - BiGQuery doesnt have type BOOLEAN it has type BOOL and it reflected in BigQueryUtils , but in this class you use BOOLEAN which is inconsistent and breaks the schema case 2044650: if (typeName.equals("BOOL")) { var3 = 6; } break; **Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-3083] Sets sdk_harness_container_images property for all Dataflow Runner V2 jobs
body:
Currently this is only set for x-lang jobs. We can set this for all jobs now that corresponding Dataflow API is stable. This will make container setup for x-lang and non-x-lang jobs for runner V2 behave in a similar manner. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-10481] Ensure registration of the accumulator occurs.
body:
Move registration of accumulator so as to include those recovered from checkpoints. Prior to this, if the accumulator was recovered from a checkpoint it would not be registered, resulting in a runtime exception. R: @jbonofre ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [X] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [X] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-7523] Fix starting Kafka container twice in KafkaCSVTableIT
body:
I made a mistake and Kafka Container starts twice in KafkaCSVTableIT (@Rule KafkaContainer makes it start and stop automatically). It may result in leaving redundant containers on the VMs. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10886] Fix Java Wordcount Direct Runner (windows-latest)
body:
This fixes the java wordcount direct runner test on windows by using the Gradle Github action. Gradle Github action will use the `.bat` script on windows instead of the `gradlew` bash script. The issue was that the previous test was running the test on windows using the `gradlew` bash script instead of the `gradlew.bat` which is what should be used on Windows. Github actions has msys installed which would mean that the `gradlew` bash script would not parse the arguments as expected. The quotes would be removed from the `pipelineOptionsString` which would mean it was invalid JSON. See https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-10886 for more details. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10894] Support for more pandas formats.
body:
This builds on https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/12841 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10895] Support UNNEST an (possibly nested) array field of an struct column
body:
Currently Beam ZetaSQL only support UNNEST an array column of a table: e.g. `SELECT * FROM table, UNNEST(table.array_col)` From the ZetaSQL spec, UNNEST should also work on (possibly nested) array field of an struct column: e.g. 1: `SELECT * FROM table, UNNEST(table.struct_col.array_field)` e.g. 2: `SELECT * FROM table, UNNEST(table.struct_col.struct_field.array_field)` ... This PR gets queries like above working. r: @amaliujia @apilloud See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10889] Add a note about BatchElements on GroupIntoBatches pages.
body:
A full page would be best, but we should at least have a reference as this has come up several times. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10906] Add basic ToRows transform.
body:
This will make it easier to create schema'd PCollections. This includes improvements to type inference to be able to better understand the Row type and apply getattr(...). ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10868] Fix build (docker run) concurrency issue when building golang license dependencies
body:
The Go language license dependencies are built when Pdocker-pull-licenses is specified, which is the default for Jenkins jobs but not interactive builds. This caused flakiness in Jenkins builds when there were concurrent build steps for the same SDK because the build used Docker and Docker can have only one running container with a given name. This change: 1) adds a random number to the container name to avoid collisions 2) uses the cached output of the golang license generation, to speed up builds R:apilloud ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9399] Change DataflowWorkerLoggingHandler to report errors to t…
body:
…he original System.err Currently such errors are logged to System.err which is a PrintStream that publishes to the handler. This is perhaps unlikely to work if earlier publishing failed and additionally removes a potential deadlock between the PrintStream object sychronization and the Handler object synchronization. This was attempted to be fixed earlier by dissallowing the PrintStream object to be synchronized when calling into the handler. However this is possible to be triggered by external synchronization on the PrintStream, such as that performed by Throwable.printStackTrace. Changing the PrintStream to use separate synchronization for buffering works in most cases but not for cases where the stream is externally synchronized. **Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10882]  Update Snowflake docs
body:

Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: Bump versions of protobuf, shadow, other gradle plugins.
body:
This bumps the versions of the protobuf gradle plugin, the shadow plugin, the spotless plugin and the Gradle Enterprise gradle plugin to the latest. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10875] Support NUMERIC in spanner schema parser
body:
R: @chamikaramj, @nielm Spanner library supports new column type NUMERIC since 1.59. We needs to support this type in spanner schema parser. This issue is the follow-up task of the following PR : https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/12695/commits/4efc91b56d682bfc90a279b0652015226f973310 NOTE: I have run presubmit job and passed. ./gradlew spotlessApply && ./gradlew checkstyleMain checkstyleTest javadoc spotbugsMain compileJava compileTestJava ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [X] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [X] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-10874] Support v2 Go protos.
body:
Per https://pkg.go.dev/mod/google.golang.org/protobuf there's a v2 variant of generated protocol buffer code for Go. As it stands, technically the v1 variants are now implemented in terms of v2, except that the base interface is now protoreflect.Message, rather than proto.MessageV. They are implemented differently, which prevents the existing beam code from "discovering" protocol buffer types on pipeline analysis. This PR resolves it. Additionally, use the v2 marshaller/unmarshaller explicitly for user elements. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9547] A couple trivial but common dataframe methods.
body:
------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier).
